{"step_by_step_thinking": "Intake of unsaturated fatty acids is generally associated with a decreased risk of cardiovascular disease. Unsaturated fatty acids, such as omega-3 and omega-6 fatty acids, have been shown to have beneficial effects on heart health by reducing inflammation, improving blood lipid profiles, and decreasing the risk of blood clot formation. On the other hand, intake of saturated and trans fats is associated with an increased risk of cardiovascular disease. Therefore, the answer is B. Decreased risk of cardiovascular disease.", "answer_choice": "B"}
